Acidic Poison Cloud Trap.name: Acidic Poison Cloud Trap
Acidic Poison Cloud Trap.hpDetails: to destroy a nozzle; Tank Hardness 20; TankHP 100 (BT 50) to damage the tank enough to stop it from spewing gas
Acidic Poison Cloud Trap.descriptionHazard: Five nozzles hidden across the apartment's ceiling spew thick clouds of acidic poison from a reinforced tank behind the wall.
Acidic Poison Cloud Trap.disable: @Check[type:thievery|dc:35|name:Block One Nozzle|traits:action:disable-a-device] (expert) to block one of the nozzles or @Check[type:thievery|dc:40|name:Shut Off the Tank|traits:action:disable-a-device] (master) to shut off the tank. The trap deactivates after 5 rounds, once the tank is empty.
Acidic Poison Cloud Trap.routine: (1 action) When it's triggered, the trap has five active nozzles, but at the end of its turn each round, one random nozzle deactivates. On the trap's turn, the active nozzles emit a cloud of acidic poison gas that expands to fill the apartment. The cloud deals @Damage[1d6[acid]] damage and @Damage[1d6[poison]] damage per active nozzle to each creature and object in the room (@Check[type:fortitude|dc:33|basic:true|name:Spew Cloud|traits:poison] save). Unattended objects automatically fail saves to avoid the damage.

Agent of the Gray Queen.name: Agent of the Gray Queen
Agent of the Gray Queen.allSavesBonus: +1 status to all saves vs. magic

Agradaemon.name: Agradaemon
Agradaemon.allSavesBonus: +1 status to all saves vs. magic

Arcane Feedback Trap.name: Arcane Feedback Trap
Arcane Feedback Trap.descriptionHazard: A spike of stone bursts from the south wall and quickly retracts.
Arcane Feedback Trap.disable: @Check[type:arcana|dc:33|name:Quell Rippling Stone] (master) to quell the rippling stone or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} (7th level, counteract DC 31) to dispel the magical feedback.

Avsheros the Betrayer.name: Avsheros the Betrayer
Avsheros the Betrayer.allSavesBonus: +1 status to all saves vs. magic

Baatamidar.name: Baatamidar
Baatamidar.publicNotes: Baatamidars are drawn to destroy planar communities on the fringes where the Outer Planes touch the chaos of the Maelstrom. They resemble floating blobs of undulating, prismatic ooze with four quivering tentacles and dribbles of oily slime that always drip upwards.

Blackfinger's Prayer.name: Blackfinger's Prayer
Blackfinger's Prayer.descriptionHazard: The trapdoor's metal is infused with a deadly toxin that seeps out when the trap is triggered.
Blackfinger's Prayer.disable: @Check[type:thievery|dc:50|name:Gum Up Trapdoor|traits:action:disable-a-device] (legendary) to gum up the trapdoor's porous metal surface, @Check[type:crafting|dc:45|name:Render Toxin Inert] (master) to render the toxin inert, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} (9th level; counteract DC 45) to counteract the trap's magic

Boiling Fountains.name: Boiling Fountains
Boiling Fountains.descriptionHazard: Four pressure plates beneath the floorboards activate dragon-headed fountains on either side of the room, which spray boiling water across the area between them.
Boiling Fountains.disable: @Check[type:thievery|dc:21|name:Disable Pressure Plate|traits:action:disable-a-device] (trained) to disable each pressure plate, @Check[type:thievery|dc:16|name:Jam Fountain|traits:action:disable-a-device] to jam each fountain, or @Check[type:thievery|dc:18|name:Deflect Fountain's Spray|traits:action:disable-a-device] to deflect a fountain's spray
Boiling Fountains.reset: Once a pressure plate has been activated, it must be reset manually.

Boiling Tub Trap.name: Boiling Tub Trap
Boiling Tub Trap.descriptionHazard: A snapped trip wire causes an alchemical bomb to detonate and blow up part of the tin tub, spilling boiling water all over the trap's victim.
Boiling Tub Trap.disable: @Check[type:thievery|dc:32|name:Remove Trip Wire|traits:action:disable-a-device] (master) to safely remove the trip wire from the bomb

Burning Chandelier Trap.name: Burning Chandelier Trap
Burning Chandelier Trap.descriptionHazard: Four large flaming chandeliers swing wildly around the room.
Burning Chandelier Trap.disable: @Check[type:thievery|dc:36|name:Disable a Chandelier|traits:action:disable-a-device] (master) to disable a chandelier or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} (8th level; counteract DC 33) to permanently drain the magic from a chandelier. Any amount of cold damage that overcomes a chandelier's cold resistance extinguishes its flames and removes its persistent fire damage and flame dart attack. @Check[type:thievery|dc:41|name:Disable Trap (Control Panel)|traits:action:disable-a-device] (legendary) to disable the entire trap from the hidden control panel in the southeast corner of the room.
Burning Chandelier Trap.reset: The trap deactivates and resets 1 minute after there are no living creatures remaining in the room.
Burning Chandelier Trap.routine: (4 actions) For every chandelier disabled, the trap's actions are reduced by 1. For each of the trap's actions, a different chandelier attacks a random creature in the room. A chandelier uses its swinging chandelier attack if it can, but it can't make melee attacks against creatures in the cage, the closet, or the gap between the two double doors leading into the vault. Against a creature it can't reach with a melee attack, it uses a flame dart attack instead. The trap doesn't take multiple attack penalties.
Burning Chandelier Trap.stealth: (master) or @Check[type:perception|dc:38|traits:action:seek] (master) to spot the trap's control panel

Canopy Drop.name: Canopy Drop
Canopy Drop.descriptionHazard: A trapdoor, connected to floor sensors, opens in the section of floor marked on the map, while the surrounding floor suddenly tilts to a 45-degree angle and the fountains in the wall begin spraying at high pressure, making the tile slippery and pushing creatures toward the open chute.
Canopy Drop.disable: @Check[type:thievery|dc:23|name:Jam Trapdoor Mechanism|traits:action:disable-a-device] (expert) to jam the mechanisms and keep the trapdoor from opening, or to locate the bypass switch hidden under a stair riser just outside the room

Carvey.name: Carvey
Carvey.publicNotes: Made of odd scraps of skin and muscle, a flesh golem is a grotesque parody of life. Though it has no mind, it can still go into a berserk rage when harmed, giving it a faint semblance of emotion. Flesh golems guard the laboratories and charnel houses of fleshwarpers and necromancers who feel no compunctions about desecrating corpses for their own ends. Though the first flesh golem is believed to have been a misguided attempt to create from simple base elements, these monstrosities are far from human. In isolated cases, echoes of a personality might rise in a flesh golem if the brain used as part of its construction belonged to a particularly powerful personality, but such tragic instances are rare in the extreme.

Chalky.name: Chalky
Chalky.publicNotes: This golem is a walking alchemical nightmare capable of inflicting all manner of painful wounds. Its ability to follow orders is granted by the otherwise mindless humanoid brain that floats in its dome-like head. In exceptionally rare cases, the brain used in its creation might retain fragments of memories or even actual intellect, resulting in an alchemical golem with a personality and agenda of its own.

Clockwork Arms.name: Clockwork Arms
Clockwork Arms.descriptionHazard: Four claw-tipped clockwork arms suspended from the ceiling pick up and deposit creatures into a nearby hatch.
Clockwork Arms.disable: @Check[type:thievery|dc:43|name:Deactivate One Arm|traits:action:disable-a-device] (master) to jam and deactivate one of the arms or @Check[type:athletics|dc:46|name:Tear Arm Off Machine] (legendary) to tear an arm off the machine.
Clockwork Arms.routine: (4 actions) The trap loses 1 action per arm destroyed or disabled. On its turn, the trap makes claw Strikes against creatures other than the Rumormonger or the Inkmaster. If an arm already has a creature grabbed, the trap spends 2 actions to use its Open Hatch ability.

Clockwork Poison Bomb.name: Clockwork Poison Bomb
Clockwork Poison Bomb.hpDetails: to ruin the nozzle (making it impossible to disable, in which case the only way to disarm the bomb is to destroy both its tanks); Tank Hardness 15; Tank HP 80 (BT 40) to destroy one of the tanks (both tanks must be destroyed to disarm the bomb
Clockwork Poison Bomb.descriptionHazard: A clockwork bomb releases gouts of poisonous smoke. The smoke issues forth from a single nozzle attached to two tanks of pressurized poison
Clockwork Poison Bomb.disable: Three @Check[type:thievery|dc:31|name:Disable a Latch|traits:action:disable-a-device] (expert) checks to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.cYdz2grcOcRt4jk6]{Disable a Device} to disable the latches that lock the nozzle in place, then one @Check[type:thievery|dc:35|name:Turn Off Nozzle|traits:action:disable-a-device] (master) check to Disable a Device to turn off the nozzle; DCs decrease by 2 if Oggvurm is immobilized, paralyzed, unconscious, or dead
Clockwork Poison Bomb.reset: The trap issues smoke for 3 minutes before its tanks run dry. The tanks must be replaced before the bomb can be reactivated.
Clockwork Poison Bomb.routine: (1 action) On its turn, the bomb spews forth a smoky gout of airborne @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.WvDbdESFJY6Be2u1]{Blackfinger Blight} poison. The cloud fills a 20-foot radius, or a 10-foot radius if only one tank remains intact. If the bomb is already in the center of a blackfinger blight cloud, the radius of that cloud increases by 20 feet (or 10 feet, if only one tank remains intact) instead.
Clockwork Poison Bomb.stealth: The bomb uses Oggvurm's initiative roll as its Stealth roll

Dart Barrage.name: Dart Barrage
Dart Barrage.hpDetails: (BT 30) to destroy the seal and disable the trap
Dart Barrage.descriptionHazard: Four dart-loaded pipes hidden in the diagonal walls are connected to a pressure plate under the brass seal in the room's center.
Dart Barrage.disable: @Check[type:thievery|dc:22|name:Disable Pressure Plate|traits:action:disable-a-device] (trained) to disable the pressure plate, or four @Check[type:thievery|dc:18|name:Plug Dart Launcher|traits:action:disable-a-device] (trained) checks to plug the dart launchers
Dart Barrage.reset: The trap runs out of darts after 4 rounds of firing and must be reset manually by dismantling the walls to reload the launchers. If at any point there are no longer more than two creatures placing weight on the floor, the trap ceases firing but remains armed, ready to resume firing its remaining darts once triggered again.
Dart Barrage.routine: (4 actions) The trap loses 1 action for each disabled launcher. On each of the trap's actions, it fires one dart at a creature in the center of the room.
Dart Barrage.stealth: (trained) or @Check[type:perception|dc:23|traits:action:seek] (trained) to notice scratches around the musical pipes and a slight give to the seal

Dreadsong Dancer.name: Dreadsong Dancer
Dreadsong Dancer.allSavesBonus: +2 status to all saves vs. composition spells

Exploding Statue.name: Exploding Statue
Exploding Statue.descriptionHazard: A hollow statue filled with explosives is connected to a trip wire running along the adjacent door.
Exploding Statue.disable: @Check[type:thievery|dc:21|name:Safely Cut Wire|traits:action:disable-a-device] (trained) to safely cut the wire

Explosive Barrels.name: Explosive Barrels
Explosive Barrels.descriptionHazard: Wooden barrels marked with an oil-drop symbol catch fire and explode.
Explosive Barrels.disable: @Check[type:survival|dc:20|name:Smother the Flames] to smother the flames without rupturing the barrels

Eyeball Tank.name: Eyeball Tank
Eyeball Tank.descriptionHazard: A vat of thick glass stands 10 feet high and is filled with green slime and fist-sized eyeballs.
Eyeball Tank.disable: @Check[type:thievery|dc:38|name:Acidify Slime|traits:action:disable-a-device] (master) or @Check[type:crafting|dc:34|name:Acidify Slime] (expert) to acidify the slime inside the tank, destroying the eyeballs
Eyeball Tank.routine: (3 actions) Each round, the vat uses all three of its actions to shoot random eye rays at any living creatures (except Ixusoth) in range.

False Door Trap.name: False Door Trap
False Door Trap.descriptionHazard: A hidden needle delivers a magical poison to anyone trying to open the door.
False Door Trap.disable: @Check[type:thievery|dc:32|name:Jam Needle in Housing|traits:action:disable-a-device] (master) to jam the needle in its housing or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} (6th level, counteract DC 30) to dispel the magical poison.

Field Of Opposition.name: Field Of Opposition
Field Of Opposition.descriptionHazard: A distortion in space spawns an aggressive, malevolent shadow duplicate of any characters who pass between Terimor's faces.
Field Of Opposition.disable: @Check[type:thievery|dc:42|name:Disable Thievery] (legendary) to permanently disable the planar distortion (DC increases by 2 for each duplicate still extant), or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} (10th level; counteract DC 42) to destroy the planar distortion

Flying Guillotine.name: Flying Guillotine
Flying Guillotine.descriptionHazard: An invisible magical glyph on the guillotine's blade detects living creatures in the room, which causes the guillotine to fly off its hinges and attack.
Flying Guillotine.disable: @Check[type:thievery|dc:20|name:Erase Glyph|traits:action:disable-a-device] (trained) to erase the glyph (which requires a successful unarmed attack roll if the blade is already active) or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} (3rd level; counteract DC 20) to counteract it. The trap has a secret bypass known only to Ralso and Pratchett: as long as the guillotine can see a creature in the room touching thumb and pinky together with an empty hand, it remains dormant.
Flying Guillotine.reset: After 1 minute, the trap deactivates, though the door remains locked. The trap rearms itself each day at dawn.
Flying Guillotine.routine: (1 action) The blade @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.cS9nfDRGD83bNU1p]{Flies} up to 20 feet and Strikes any creatures whose squares it passes through. It cannot target the same creature more than once per round. The blade cannot be grappled and doesn't take a multiple attack penalty.

Franca Laurentz.name: Franca Laurentz
Franca Laurentz.allSavesBonus: +2 circumstance bonus to saves vs. poison

Freezing Alarm.name: Freezing Alarm
Freezing Alarm.descriptionHazard: Miniature snowflake-shaped glyphs on the ground cause a layer of ice to ripple over the floor of the room and sound a silent alarm.
Freezing Alarm.disable: @Check[type:arcana|dc:53|name:Disable Arcana] (legendary) to draw a fiery counteracting glyph over each snowflake, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} (9th level, counteract DC 48)

Gas Trap.name: Gas Trap
Gas Trap.descriptionHazard: A spring slams and locks the room's door before four hidden gas vents begin pumping poison gas into the chamber.
Gas Trap.disable: Four @Check[type:thievery|dc:20|name:Block Gas Vents|traits:action:disable-a-device] checks to block the gas vents, or a @Check[type:thievery|dc:26|name:Unlock Door|traits:action:pick-a-lock] check to unlock the door and escape
Gas Trap.reset: The trap must be manually rearmed by unblocking the vents or replacing the poison gas tank in area E30.
Gas Trap.routine:
(1 action) Each round on its initiative count, the trap pumps more toxic gas into the room.

Any breathing creature in the room takes @Damage[4d6[poison]] damage (a successful @Check[type:fortitude|dc:22|traits:poison,damaging-effect] save halves the damage taken). If a creature acts before the trap on the first round, it has the option of holding its breath to postpone taking damage from the trap-holding one's breath after the trap's first action has no effect, since the air in the creature's lungs is already tainted. Locating and blocking one of the hidden gas vents reduces the poison damage by 1d6-if all four are blocked, the trap is disabled, though the door remains locked. Otherwise, the trap functions for 1 minute before all the gas is expended and characters in the room cease taking damage, after which the trap ventilates the room for 1 additional minute.
Gas Trap.stealth: (trained) to smell the poison gas or hear it hissing

Grabble Forden.name: Grabble Forden
Grabble Forden.allSavesBonus: +1 status to all saves vs. magic

Greater Planar Rift.name: Greater Planar Rift
Greater Planar Rift.descriptionHazard: A ragged planar rift drags things into its depths and hurls creatures through from its terminal end.
Greater Planar Rift.disable: @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} (9th level; counteract DC 46) to seal the rift

Grunka.name: Grunka
Grunka.publicNotes:
The frontline fighters of goblin tribes prefer to fight in large groups-especially when they can outnumber their foes at least three to one.

These small humanoids have green or gray skin and large heads with wide ears. While some goblins are civilized and have worked hard to be considered upstanding members of humanoid communities, most are impetuous and vicious creatures who delight in wreaking havoc. These goblins think nothing of slaughtering livestock, stealing infants, or burning down a building purely for momentary delight. They revel in playing malicious tricks on taller humanoids, whom they call "longshanks."

Goblins are superstitious, with an intense awe of magic and a fascination with fire; goblins who master magic or fire earn great respect from their kin. Most other humanoids find it difficult to understand goblins' outlook: they hate canines but eagerly share their lairs with so-called "goblin dogs," they fearlessly attack larger creatures but are terrified of horses, and they despise vegetables yet consider pickles a delicacy. To a goblin, of course, these are all perfectly sensible life choices.

Hands Of The Forgotten.name: Hands Of The Forgotten
Hands Of The Forgotten.descriptionHazard: Ethereal hands stretch out from the walls and floor, attempting to restrain nearby creatures.
Hands Of The Forgotten.disable: @Check[type:religion|dc:30|name:Exorcise Spirits] (master) to exorcise the spirits or @Check[type:intimidation|dc:32|name:Scare Away the Hands|traits:action:demoralize] (expert) to scare away the hands

Hegessik.name: Hegessik
Hegessik.allSavesBonus: +1 status to all saves vs. divine magic

Hestriviniaas.name: Hestriviniaas
Hestriviniaas.allSavesBonus: +1 status to all saves vs. magic

Hidden Chute.name: Hidden Chute
Hidden Chute.descriptionHazard: A trapdoor in the floor conceals a stone chute.
Hidden Chute.disable: @Check[type:thievery|dc:20|name:Remove Trapdoor|traits:action:disable-a-device] (trained) to remove the trapdoor or lock it in position using a catch hidden inside the room's doorframe

Hundun Chaos Mage.name: Hundun Chaos Mage
Hundun Chaos Mage.allSavesBonus: +1 status to all saves vs. magic

Ink Drowning Vats.name: Ink Drowning Vats
Ink Drowning Vats.descriptionHazard: Steel hatch doors automatically lock shut in each of the four vats labeled J2. Four ink spouts (one per vat) jut through a narrow aperture in the ceiling of each vat, 20 feet above.
Ink Drowning Vats.disable: @Check[type:thievery|dc:40|name:Seal an Ink Spout|traits:action:disable-a-device] (master) to seal an ink spout, @Check[type:thievery|dc:48|name:Unlock a Door|traits:action:pick-a-lock] (master) to unlock a steel hatch door, or @Check[type:athletics|dc:45|name:Force Open a Door|traits:action:force-open] (master) to Force Open a steel hatch door
Ink Drowning Vats.reset: The trap can be reset by refilling the ink storage tanks above the vats.
Ink Drowning Vats.routine: (4 actions) The trap loses 1 action for each disabled ink spout. On each of the trap's actions, a spout pours ink, increasing the depth of the ink in that vat by 2 feet. Creatures standing in the ink are exposed to a dose of poison ink. Once the vat is full of ink, the trap stops using actions, but creatures in the vat might start drowning.

Inky Tendrils.name: Inky Tendrils
Inky Tendrils.descriptionHazard: Six giant tentacles reach up from the ink lake, grabbing any foes in reach and dragging them underwater.
Inky Tendrils.disable:
@Check[type:athletics|dc:48|name:Disable Athletics] (legendary) or @Check[type:athletics|dc:45|name:Disable Acrobatics]{Acrobatics} (master) to tie one tentacle into a knot, rendering it useless, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} (8th level; counteract DC 44) to counteract one tentacle.

The death of the Daemonic Rumormonger permanently dispels all the inky tendrils.
Inky Tendrils.routine: (6 actions) The hazard loses 1 action for every tentacle that is disabled or destroyed. The tentacles can combine their actions to use the hazard's Inky Imitator ability. A broken tentacle can still Strike, but it can't Grab. This hazard takes no multiple attack penalty.

Iron Maiden Trap.name: Iron Maiden Trap
Iron Maiden Trap.descriptionHazard: A pressure plate hidden on the floor before an iron maiden causes the torture device to snap shut and trap the triggering creature inside.
Iron Maiden Trap.disable: @Check[type:thievery|dc:28|name:Disable Pressure Plate|traits:action:disable-a-device] to disable the pressure plate
Iron Maiden Trap.reset: The pressure plate must be reset manually.

Ixusoth.name: Ixusoth
Ixusoth.allSavesBonus: +2 status to all saves vs. magic

Izfiitar.name: Izfiitar
Izfiitar.allSavesBonus: +1 status to all saves vs. magic

Jonis Flakfatter.name: Jonis Flakfatter
Jonis Flakfatter.allSavesBonus: +2 status to all saves vs. disease and poison

Kharnas's Lesser Glyph.name: Kharnas's Lesser Glyph
Kharnas's Lesser Glyph.descriptionHazard: A hidden glyph suddenly lights up and dominates the mind of any creature not bearing the sigil of Kharnas the Angel-Binder.
Kharnas's Lesser Glyph.disable: Disable @Check[type:thievery|dc:46|name:Destroy Glyph|traits:action:disable-a-device] (legendary) to destroy the glyph, @Check[type:arcana|dc:42|name:Divert Glyph's Power] (master) to harmlessly divert the glyph's power, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} (7th level; counteract DC 38) to counteract the glyph
Kharnas's Lesser Glyph.reset: The glyph can affect two creatures before it deactivates for 5 minutes and automatically resets.

Lie-Master.name: Lie-Master
Lie-Master.publicNotes:
Glabrezus are looming behemoths who revel in the act of twisting mortal desires into their ultimate ruin, betraying and manipulating as easily as they breathe. Desires granted by a glabrezu always come to fruition in the most destructive way possible, turning a wish or hope into a potent and devastating act of betrayal-although the long-term repercussions are not always immediately apparent. For example, a struggling weapon smith might wish for fame and skill at their craft, only to find that their best patron is a cruel and sadistic murderer who uses the weapons in bloody sprees. Or a lonely widower might have his desire granted in the form of a lost love returned to "life" as a vampire. Glabrezus are nothing if not creative in addressing a mortal's needs.

These massive demons have enormous pincers and a pair of smaller humanoid arms sprouting from their chests, but their size belies their skill at magic, and they possess formidable innate spells. Treachery demons arise from the souls of mortals engaged in treason and deception.
Lie-Master.allSavesBonus: +1 status to all saves vs. magic

Life Magnet.name: Life Magnet
Life Magnet.descriptionHazard: A magical magnet hidden behind a panel in the corner of the room pulls not metal but living creatures toward it, heedless of any obstacles in the way.
Life Magnet.disable: @Check[type:thievery|dc:29|name:Deactivate Panel|traits:action:disable-a-device] (expert) to deactivate the panel, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic};(4th level; counteract DC 22) to counteract the panel's magic
Life Magnet.reset: The trap deactivates and resets 1 minute after there are no creatures touching the iron bars.
Life Magnet.routine:
(1 action) The trap pulls up to four creatures that have already triggered its Magnetize the Living ability toward one of the far corners of the room, possibly pressing them into the iron bars. If all the iron bars between an affected creature and the magnetic panel remain intact, the creature takes @Damage[(2d10+10)[bludgeoning]] damage with a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:25]{DC 25 basic Fortitude} save and is restrained on a failure (Escape DC 23).

If an iron bar has been broken, the creature takes @Damage[(1d10+5)[bludgeoning]] damage instead, and if two consecutive bars have been broken the creature takes no damage (but might still be restrained on a failed save).

Living Paints.name: Living Paints
Living Paints.descriptionHazard: A mass of brushes use magical paint to convert creatures into art.
Living Paints.disable: @Check[type:crafting|dc:41|name:Crafting Disable] (master) to mix the paints into bland, useless colors, @Check[type:thievery|dc:41|name:Thievery Disable] (legendary) to dismantle the animated brushes, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} (8th level; counteract DC 41) to counteract the magic within the paint.

Lusca.name: Lusca
Lusca.publicNotes: A lusca is a predatory sea monster that resembles a three-headed shark with the body of an octopus. Ferocious electrical storms usually herald a lusca's arrival; such violent bursts of electricity result from the creature's superconductive flesh, which allows the lusca to store energy from lightning strikes that it can then discharge at foes.

Maurrisa Jonne.name: Maurrisa Jonne
Maurrisa Jonne.allSavesBonus: +1 status bonus to saves vs. incapacitation effects, +2 status bonus to saves vs. Shove and Trip

Miogimo.name: Miogimo
Miogimo.allSavesBonus: +1 status bonus to Will saves vs. mental effects

Mr. Snips.name: Mr. Snips
Mr. Snips.publicNotes: Traditionally crafted into the forms of giant suits of armor or powerful animals, iron golems are products of exquisite artistry and skill. Their articulated joints and sturdy armored bodies require great care and mathematical precision to craft, and regular cleaning and oiling ensure they don't rust over the ages. With proper care, iron golems can remain in good shape for thousands of years, being passed down for generations, as long as they aren't destroyed by meddlesome adventurers. In addition to their incredible strength, iron golems possess a potent toxic breath weapon that is often more than enough to dispatch entire groups of opponents.

Needling Stairs.name: Needling Stairs
Needling Stairs.hpDetails: to break the spring under the step and make that step safe to stand on
Needling Stairs.descriptionHazard: This staircase has springs in each step, which send poisoned needles shooting up through tiny holes in the wood when stepped on. Each step, 6 in total, takes up one 5-foot square.
Needling Stairs.disable: @Check[type:thievery|dc:33|name:Disable Stair Spring|traits:action:disable-a-device] (master) on each stair to disable its spring, or deactivate the switch in area C8 to deactivate the whole trap. Cutting the wire on the topmost stair (>@Check[type:thievery|dc:35|name:Cut Wire on Top-Most Stair|traits:action:disable-a-device] to Disable the Device) that connects the staircase to the control switch prevents the control switch from turning the trap on or off.
Needling Stairs.reset: If deactivated via the switch, the trap can be reactivated with the switch in area C8.
Needling Stairs.routine: (1 action) The trap makes a separate poisoned needle Strike against each creature currently on an active step as 1 action. Because it is constantly jabbing needles up through any weight-bearing steps, the trap can also use its Bloody Feet free action to jab at a creature on one of the steps during that creature's turn.

Nenchuuj.name: Nenchuuj
Nenchuuj.allSavesBonus: +2 status to all saves vs. magic

Overdrive Imentesh.name: Overdrive Imentesh
Overdrive Imentesh.allSavesBonus: +1 status to all saves vs. magic

Pelmo.name: Pelmo
Pelmo.publicNotes:
The frontline fighters of goblin tribes prefer to fight in large groups-especially when they can outnumber their foes at least three to one.

These small humanoids have green or gray skin and large heads with wide ears. While some goblins are civilized and have worked hard to be considered upstanding members of humanoid communities, most are impetuous and vicious creatures who delight in wreaking havoc. These goblins think nothing of slaughtering livestock, stealing infants, or burning down a building purely for momentary delight. They revel in playing malicious tricks on taller humanoids, whom they call "longshanks."

Goblins are superstitious, with an intense awe of magic and a fascination with fire; goblins who master magic or fire earn great respect from their kin. Most other humanoids find it difficult to understand goblins' outlook: they hate canines but eagerly share their lairs with so-called "goblin dogs," they fearlessly attack larger creatures but are terrified of horses, and they despise vegetables yet consider pickles a delicacy. To a goblin, of course, these are all perfectly sensible life choices.

Penqual.name: Penqual
Penqual.allSavesBonus: +1 status to all saves vs. magic

Plunger Chute.name: Plunger Chute
Plunger Chute.descriptionHazard: A trapdoor in the floor conceals a hidden chute, and a moving section of wall shoves victims into it.
Plunger Chute.disable: @Check[type:thievery|dc:23|name:Jam the Trapdoor Shut|traits:action:disable-a-device] (expert) to jam the trapdoor shut or activate a hidden bypass switch by twisting a fitting on the gas lamp

Poisoned Dart Statue.name: Poisoned Dart Statue
Poisoned Dart Statue.descriptionHazard: Countless poison darts fire from holes in the statues and walls of this hall.
Poisoned Dart Statue.disable: @Check[type:thievery|dc:34|name:Disable Trap|traits:action:disable-a-device] (master) on the control panel deactivates the trap.
Poisoned Dart Statue.reset: The trap deactivates and resets after 1 minute.
Poisoned Dart Statue.routine: (1 action) The trap launches one dart against every creature in the hall as 1 action. Because it launches darts continuously, the trap can also use the Continuous Barrage free action (see below) to launch darts at each creature during that creature's turn. The trap doesn't take a multiple attack penalty.
Poisoned Dart Statue.stealth: (expert) or @Check[type:perception|dc:39|traits:action:seek] (master) to notice the control panel. Anyone specifically searching the name plate of Abresha Tallow-Hands locates the control panel automatically.

Prospecti Statue.name: Prospecti Statue
Prospecti Statue.publicNotes: As with any humanoid animated statues of Medium size, giant animated statues are used to guard locations of importance, but their increased size and power make them most useful in large vaults, spacious chambers, or outdoor locations. Animated objects of this strength and size are ideal for tasks and responsibilities usually performed by golems, and more powerful animated objects are thus all but unheard of.

Pulping Golem.name: Pulping Golem
Pulping Golem.publicNotes: Traditionally crafted into the forms of giant suits of armor or powerful animals, iron golems are products of exquisite artistry and skill. Their articulated joints and sturdy armored bodies require great care and mathematical precision to craft, and regular cleaning and oiling ensure they don't rust over the ages. With proper care, iron golems can remain in good shape for thousands of years, being passed down for generations, as long as they aren't destroyed by meddlesome adventurers. In addition to their incredible strength, iron golems possess a potent toxic breath weapon that is often more than enough to dispatch entire groups of opponents.

Rhevanna.name: Rhevanna
Rhevanna.allSavesBonus: +1 status to all saves vs. magic

Rigged Cubby.name: Rigged Cubby
Rigged Cubby.descriptionHazard: A hidden string connected to precariously stacked bricks causes the cubby to collapse in on itself when the string is pulled.
Rigged Cubby.disable: @Check[type:thievery|dc:20|name:Cut String|traits:action:disable-a-device] to cut the string without setting off the trap

Secret-Keeper.name: Secret-Keeper
Secret-Keeper.allSavesBonus: +1 status to all saves vs. mental

Sordesdaemon.name: Sordesdaemon
Sordesdaemon.allSavesBonus: +1 status to all saves vs. magic

Summoning Rune (Barbazu Devil).name: Summoning Rune (Barbazu Devil)
Summoning Rune (Barbazu Devil).descriptionHazard: A summoning circle inlaid into the room's floor detects living creatures and summons a violent devil.
Summoning Rune (Barbazu Devil).disable: @Check[type:perception|dc:18|name:Notice the Trap's Magic|traits:action:seek] to notice the trap's magic and avoid stepping on the floor outside the circle, followed by @Check[type:thievery|dc:21|name:Break Summoning Circle|traits:action:disable-a-device] (trained) to break the circle or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} (3rd level; counteract DC 23) to counteract the rune
Summoning Rune (Barbazu Devil).reset: The trap resets each day at dawn.

Summoning Rune (Cinder Rat).name: Summoning Rune (Cinder Rat)
Summoning Rune (Cinder Rat).descriptionHazard: An invisible cloud of magical sensors detects living creatures in the room and summons fire elementals to slay the creatures.
Summoning Rune (Cinder Rat).disable: @Check[type:acrobatics|dc:22|name:Approach Rune] (trained) to approach without triggering the trap, followed by @Check[type:thievery|dc:22|name:Erase Summoning Rune|traits:action:disable-a-device] (trained) to erase the rune or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} (3rd level; counteract DC 20) to counteract the rune
Summoning Rune (Cinder Rat).reset: The trap resets each day at dawn.

Supplicant Statues.name: Supplicant Statues
Supplicant Statues.descriptionHazard: Six statues rapidly slide around the room on rollers, slowing down intruders and striking at them with spring-loaded sword arms.
Supplicant Statues.disable: @Check[type:thievery|dc:34|name:Disable Statue Rollers|traits:action:disable-a-device] (master) to disable a specific statue's rollers, or @Check[type:thievery|dc:39|name:Disable Trap (Control Panel)|traits:action:disable-a-device] (master) on the control panel in A4 deactivates the whole trap. For each statue disabled, the trap loses 1 action from its routine and the DC for its predictive impediment ability decreases by 4. @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} (7th level, counteract DC 32) doesn't harm the statues but removes the predictive impediment ability. Breaking the control panel prevents the trap from resetting.
Supplicant Statues.reset: The trap deactivates and resets one minute after the room is empty.
Supplicant Statues.routine: (6 actions) On the trap's initiative, each functioning statue slides up to 40 feet around the room and makes a statue shortsword Strike against an adjacent creature. The trap doesn't take a multiple attack penalty, and the statues' movements don't trigger reactions.

The Inkmaster.name: The Inkmaster
The Inkmaster.publicNotes:
Shemhazians rise from the souls of torturers and those who reveled in mutilating the physical bodies of their victims. Standing 35 feet tall, a shemhazian is well equipped with a wide range of talons, claws, and fangs to continue inflicting such torments on those it encounters.

Shemhazians delight in visiting torment upon mortals, of course, but more than most demons, these fiends revel in sharing the pain with their own kind. Other demons fear and hate shemhazians for this reason, with only the most powerful willing to work with a shemhazian to achieve a shared goal. Even then, the shemhazian is always on the watch for an opportunity to bring pain and suffering to its allies along with any foe.
The Inkmaster.allSavesBonus: +1 status to all saves vs. magic

The Laughing Fiend's Greeting.name: The Laughing Fiend's Greeting
The Laughing Fiend's Greeting.descriptionHazard: Subtle but deadly magical runes link this mural to Kharnas's master. Good- or neutral-aligned creatures who examine the mural witness the castle's drawbridge silently descend, revealing an endless darkness.
The Laughing Fiend's Greeting.disable: @Check[type:thievery|dc:44|name:Disable Thievery] (legendary) to obscure or mar the magical runes set into the mural, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} (9th level; counteract DC 42) to counteract the mural

The Winder.name: The Winder
The Winder.descriptionHazard: A large metallic arm, 20 feet long, is set into the floor. It rotates around the room to wind up nearby clockwork creatures.
The Winder.disable: @Check[type:thievery|dc:50|name:Deactivate System|traits:action:disable-a-device] (master) to deactivate the system, or @Check[type:athletics|dc:40|name:Jam Gears] (legendary) to jam the gears for 1 round
The Winder.reset: The Winder resets as soon as no creatures remain in the room.
The Winder.routine: (1, 2, or 4 actions, depending on the encounter's threat level) The Winder uses each of its actions to Wind clockwork assassins in the room, starting with inactive ones.

Tiderunner Aquamancer.name: Tiderunner Aquamancer
Tiderunner Aquamancer.allSavesBonus: +1 status to all saves vs. enchantments, -2 to all saves vs. aboleth effects

Ulressia The Blessed.name: Ulressia The Blessed
Ulressia The Blessed.allSavesBonus: +1 status to all saves vs. magic

Veksciralenix.name: Veksciralenix
Veksciralenix.allSavesBonus: +1 status to all saves vs. magic

Water Elemental Vessel.name: Water Elemental Vessel
Water Elemental Vessel.publicNotes: Spellcasters create elemental vessels by harvesting raw elemental energy and then binding it within a specially enchanted magic circle to grant it life.

Water Elemental Vessel (I2).name: Water Elemental Vessel (I2)
Water Elemental Vessel (I2).publicNotes: Spellcasters create elemental vessels by harvesting raw elemental energy and then binding it within a specially enchanted magic circle to grant it life.

Waxworks Onslaught Trap.name: Waxworks Onslaught Trap
Waxworks Onslaught Trap.hpDetails: to destroy a tub and prevent it from making any further attacks; Door Seal Hardness 18; Door Seal HP 72 (BT 36) to destroy the wax on a sealed door and allow anyone to escape through the door
Waxworks Onslaught Trap.descriptionHazard: Four huge tubs containing congealed wax, enchanted to melt and envelop unwary intruders, each sit atop a cold fire.
Waxworks Onslaught Trap.disable: @Check[type:thievery|dc:43|name:Drain Wax from a Tub|traits:action:disable-a-device] (master) to drain the wax from a tub or @Check[type:athletics|dc:45|name:Push Through Wax|traits:action:force-open] (master) to push through the wax blocking a sealed door and escape (other creatures must push their own way through, as the wax reseals)
Waxworks Onslaught Trap.reset: The trap deactivates and resets after 1 hour. At that time, the wax in the tubs cools and congeals, and any wax elsewhere in the room magically goes back into the tubs.
Waxworks Onslaught Trap.routine: (4 actions) The trap loses 1 action each turn per drained or destroyed tub. On each action, a different tub spews hot wax at a random creature in the room, dealing 3d12 fire damage to the target and all adjacent creatures (@Check[type:reflex|dc:35|basic:true]). On a failure or critical failure, the creature is also encased in hot wax. A creature that starts its turn encased in wax takes 8d12 fire damage and is immobilized until it Escapes the hardening wax (DC 35). Each turn it remains encased, the damage dealt by the hot wax decreases by 2d12 but the DC to Escape increases by 2 (minimum 0 damage, maximum DC 43). A creature that can't get free from the wax might suffocate.
